God has Not Taken [Mary as] a Wife or Jesus Christ as a Son, Rather, He Created All Things by His Word

But they Say, "The Christ is the Son of God," for they Changed the Truth of God into a Lie, and Revered and Served the Creature More than the Creator

3:45, Qur'an
[Remember] when the angels said, "O Mary, indeed God gives you good news of a word from Him, whose name will be the Christ, Jesus, the son of Mary - distinguished in this world and the Hereafter and among those brought near [to God]."

3:47, Qur'an
She said, "My Lord, how will I have a child when no man has touched me?"  [The angel] said, "Such is God; He creates what He wills.  When He decrees a matter, He only says to it, 'Be,' and it is."

Psalms 33:4 - 6, Torah
For the word of the Lord [is] right; and all His works [are done] in truth. He loves righteousness and judgement, the earth is full of the goodness of the Lord. The heavens were made by the word of the Lord; and all the host of them by the breath of His mouth.

6:101, Qur'an
[Thus He is the] Originator of the heavens and the earth.  How could He have a son when He does not have a wife and He created all things?  And He is Knowing of all things.

72:3, Qur'an
And [thus,] the nobleness of our Lord is exalted; He has not taken [Mary as] a wife or [Jesus as] a son.

43:15, Qur'an
But they have attributed a portion to Him [as sons] from His servants. Indeed, man is clearly ungrateful.

9:30, Qur'an
[For] the Jews say, "Ezra is the son of God;" and the Christians say, "The Christ is the son of God."  That is their statement from their mouths; they imitate the saying of those who disbelieved [before them] -

Exodus 4:22, Torah
[For they said,] "The Lord says, 'Israel [is] My son, [even] My firstborn.'"

Jeremiah 31:9, Torah
[And they said, "The Lord says,] 'I am a Father to Israel, and Ephraim [is] My firstborn.'"

10:68 - 69, Qur'an
[And thus] they have said, "God has taken a son."  He is Exalted; He is the [one] Free of need. Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth [belongs] to Him.  You have no authority for this [claim].  Do you say [something] about God which you do not know?  Say, "Indeed, those who invent falsehood about God will not succeed -

Romans 1:25, Gospel
[For they] changed the truth of God into a lie, and revered and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed forever."

Sections of Son of God

Click to Jump to a Section:

God Neither Begets, Nor is Born
They Changed God into a Man
Whom do Men Say that I, the Son of Man, am?
Believe that I am the Son of Man

God Says to it, "Be," and it is
God Created All Things
All are Your Servants
God Formed me from the Womb to be His Servant
Behold My Servant

Devils Came out, Crying, "You are the Son of God"
Satan Said, "If you are the Son of God"

It is Out of their Falsehood that they Say, "God has Begotten," for God Neither Begets, Nor is Born

For He is the First and the Last, and Thus, there was No god Formed Before Me, Neither will there be After Me, for I will Not Give My Glory to Another

37:151 - 152, Qur'an
Unquestionably, it is out of their [invented] falsehood that they say, "God has begotten," and indeed, they are liars -

John 3:16, Gospel
[For they say,] "God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten son, so that whoever believes in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.

1 John 5:1, Gospel
Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God, and everyone who loves Him who fathered, loves him also who is begotten of Him."

112:3, Qur'an
[But] He neither begets, nor is born.

Isaiah 43:10, Torah
"[So] you [are] My witnesses," the Lord says, "And My servant whom I have chosen, that you may know and believe Me, and understand that I [am] He, there was no god formed before Me, neither will there be after Me -"

57:3, Qur'an
[For] He is the First, and the Last, the Outer and the Inner, and He is Knowing of all things.

Isaiah 41:4, Torah
"[So] who has contrived and done [it], calling the generations from the beginning?  I the Lord, the First, and with the Last; I [am] He.

Isaiah 43:13, Torah
Indeed, before the day [was,] I [am] He; and [there are] none who can deliver out of My hand, I will work, and who will let it?

Isaiah 48:11 - 12, Torah
For My own sake, [even] for My own sake, I will do [it], for how should [My name] be polluted? And I will not give My glory to another. [So] listen to Me, O Jacob and Israel, My called; I [am] He; I [am] the First, I also [am] the Last -

Revelation 1:8, Gospel
I am Alpha and Omega, the Beginning and the End," says the Lord [God], who is, and who was, and who is to come, the Almighty.

Isaiah 44:6, Torah
[And] thus the Lord, the King of Israel, and his Redeemer the Lord of hosts says; "I am the First, and I am the Last; and there is no god beside Me -

23:91, Qur'an
[And thus,] God has not taken any son, nor has there ever been any god with Him. [If there had been], then each god would have gone with what it created, and some of them would have [sought to] be high above others. God is glorified above what they describe [concerning Him].

They Changed the Glory of God into an Image Made Like a Corruptible Man, for they Say, "Christ is the Son of God," and "Ezra is the Son of God"

And so they Changed the Truth of God into a Lie, for God did Not Send Any Messenger Except that Satan Threw in, but God Abrogates that which Satan Throws in - so Indeed, God is Glorified Above Having a Son

22:52 - 53, Qur'an
We did not send any messenger or prophet before you except that when Satan desired, he threw in his [own] desire [into a verse]. But God abrogates that which Satan throws in; then God makes His verses precise. And God is Knowing and Wise. [That is] so He may make what Satan throws in a trial for those who have disease in their hearts and those hard of heart. And indeed, the wrongdoers are in extreme dissension.

2:79, Qur'an
So woe to those who write the "scripture" with their own hands, then say, "This is from God," in order to exchange it for a small price. Woe to them for what their hands have written and woe to them for what they earn -

1 Chronicles 28:6, Torah
[For they say,] "He said to [David], 'Solomon your son, he will build My House and My courts, for I have chosen him [to be] My son, and I will be his Father.'"

Psalms 89:26 - 27, Torah
[And, "David] will cry to Me, 'You [are] my Father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.'  Also I will make him [My] firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth."

[2 Ezra 2:47], Torah
[And they say, "The angel] answered and said to [Ezra], 'It is the son of God, whom they have confessed in the world.'"

Acts 9:20, Gospel
[And Saul] straightaway preached the Christ in the synagogues, that he is the son of God.

9:30, Qur'an
[So] the Jews say, "Ezra is the son of God;" and the Christians say, "The Christ is the son of God." That is their statement from their mouths; they imitate the saying of those who disbelieved [before them]. May God destroy them; how are they deluded?

18:5, Qur'an
They have no knowledge of it, nor had their fathers.  The word that comes out of their mouths is [indeed] grave; they do not speak [anything] except a lie -

Romans 1:21 - 23, Gospel
[For] when they knew God, they did not glorify [Him] as God, neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations, and their foolish heart was darkened.  Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools, [for they] changed the glory of the incorruptible God into an image made like a corruptible man [Jesus, Ezra, Israel, Solomon, Ephraim, David], and birds, and fourfooted beasts [the molten calf], and creeping things.

Romans 1:25, Gospel
[And thus, they] changed the truth of God into a lie, and revered and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed forever.

4:171, Qur'an
[So] O People of the Scripture, do not commit excess in your religion or say [anything] about God except the truth. The Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, was only a messenger of God [and the Messiah], and His word which He directed to Mary and the [Holy] Spirit from Him. So believe in God and His messengers. And do not say, "Three [Trinity]," desist - [it is] better for you. Indeed, God is only one God. He is glorified above having a son. Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth [belongs] to Him. And God is sufficient as Disposer of affairs

Jesus did not come to start a new religion. Jesus is often thought of as the founder of Christianity, but, in fact, Jesus did not decree a new religion. The term “christian” was a derogatory term that eventually some believers began to apply to themselves. Jesus, however, was ushering in a Kingdom movement that was intended to begin with and stay with the Jews and extend to the gentiles. Paul, our most eminent theologian, never uses the word christian, never refers to himself or anyone else as a christian, and never calls any of the churches he writes to christians. In fact, Paul was not even willing to call himself part of a sect of Judaism, much less a different religion. (Ac 24:14) Remember, we gentiles are the wild shoot grafted into the tree.
The Gospel refers specifically to the saving work of Jesus Christ. Salvation is the "good news".
